channel.title: Gordon Freeman in Scribblenauts
channel.description:
I'm sure alot of gamers here who followed E3 a bit heard about a game called Scribblenauts, where the player can type nearly any word into the DS and be able to use it in the game.
Well, watching an interview with the developers, I noticed they used a [i]veeeeery[/i] familiar word as a weapon.
Wait until around 1:23 in the video to see its greatness
[url='https://g4tv.com/thefeed/blog/post/696607/5-People-Spent-6-Months-Researching-Words-For-Scribblenauts.html']https://g4tv.com/thefeed/blog/post/696607/5-People-Spent-6-Months-Researching-Words-For-Scribblenauts.html[/url]
Could we expect more half-life references? Headcrab, perhaps? Or Combine? I know they're kinda copyrighted, but I think Valve is a cool enough company to allow this if the developers planned this.

item.description:
Well, he said that proper names, copyrighted names, and vulgar words will not work…

item.description:
timm123:

Well, watching an interview with the developers, I noticed they used a veeeeery familiar word as a weapon.

Wait until around 1:23 in the video to see its greatness

https://g4tv.com/thefeed/blog/post/696607/5-People-Spent-6-Months-Researching-Words-For-Scribblenauts.html

Could we expect more half-life references? Headcrab, perhaps? Or Combine? I know they’re kinda copyrighted, but I think Valve is a cool enough company to allow this if the developers planned this.

Dude, it’s actually Black Mesa DS what they are making. With 9001% moar crowbars.

item.title: Gordon Freeman in Scribblenauts
item.dc:creator: Crunchy
item.description:
I don’t think it is a reference to Half-Life. You can summon watermelons too, so I just think it is a side effect of how many choices are offered.

If you could summon the gravity gun, that would be an entirely different story.

It could be a reference to Half-Life, but if it is, it’s not an obvious one.

Read full topic

item.title: Gordon Freeman in Scribblenauts
item.dc:creator: timm123
item.description:
Master Chef:

The character is using a common household tool for a weapon, so it obviously must be a half-life reference.

Whats this…hold on, word has just come in that players in Modern Warfare 2 will be able to use MP5’s and other real-world military weapons, which is an obivious reference to Half-Life.

Did you see the character? Beard, Glasses, Yellow Suit with Orange overtones…

Can’t a man dream?

Read full topic

item.title: Gordon Freeman in Scribblenauts
item.dc:creator: Hamst3r
item.description:
Master Chef:

The character is using a common household tool for a weapon, so it obviously must be a half-life reference.

Whats this…hold on, word has just come in that players in Modern Warfare 2 will be able to use MP5’s and other real-world military weapons, which is an obivious reference to Half-Life.

Yes, of all the things to spawn, in a video game, they picked a crowbar. Not to mention that the main character is wearing an orange suit and black rimmed glasses at that time too.

You’re absolutely right. Obviously not a reference to Half-Life.

Read full topic
